Package http.server

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • http.server.WebServer
  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton WebServer is a very simple web-server. Any request is responded with a very simple web-page. Modification by Camille Migozzi and Karina Du : Handling of GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE requests.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Jeff Heaton, Camille Migozzi, Karina Du

      This method creates the header and the information displayed on the page when there is a bad request.

      This method creates the header and the information displayed on the page when the request delete a file.

      This method creates the header and the information displayed on the page when the request couldn't create a file.

      This method creates the header and the information displayed on the page when the request is to get the head of a file.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public void getIndex​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
        This method creates the header and the information displayed on the page when the request is GET /. It shows the page index.
        Parameters:
        out - The PrintWriter out prints on the socket remote.

      • displayBadRequest

        Parameters:
        out - The PrintWriter out prints on the socket remote.

        Parameters:

      • addText

        public void addText​(java.io.File file,
                    java.lang.String newString)
        This method adds a text to a file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file in which you want to add a text.
        newString - The string you want to add in the file.

      • displayPutFile

        public void displayPutFile​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                           boolean newFileCreated,
                           java.lang.String nameFile)
        This method creates the header and the information displayed on the page when the request is to put a file.
        Parameters:
        out - The PrintWriter out prints on the socket remote.
        newFileCreated - The file created.
        nameFile - The name of the new file.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start the application.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line parameters are not used.
